screenshot.alt: Screenshot of a .js file in Microsoft Visual Studio Code
screenshot.caption: JS file open in Microsoft Visual Studio Code

description: Web developers use JavaScript to add dynamic and interactive elements to webpages. One of the ways developers can add JavaScript functions to a webpage is by importing them using a JS file.
Developers usually import JS files in the <head> or <body> sections of a webpage's HTML, as shown below:

JS files often contain standard or site-wide functions that a developer wants to include on each of a site's webpages. Storing the functions in a single, importable JS file makes them easier to maintain and troubleshoot.
